title: Arson in the second degree
context: [ยง708-8252] Arson in the second degree. (1) A person commits the offense of arson in the second degree if the person intentionally or knowingly sets fire to or causes to be burned property and: (a) Recklessly places another person in danger of death or bodily injury; or (b) Knowingly or recklessly damages the property of another, without the other&rsquo;s consent, in an amount exceeding $1,500. (2) Arson in the second degree is a class B felony. [L 2006, c 181, pt of ยง1]
